Class MeatMeal

java.lang.Object
hr.java.restaurant.model.Meal
hr.java.restaurant.model.MeatMeal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Meat
public final class MeatMeal extends Meal implements Meat
Represents a meat-based meal in the restaurant. This class extends Meal and implements the Meat interface. A MeatMeal includes details about the meat type, and provides specific implementations for checking if the meat is raw and if it comes with a side.

      public MeatMeal(String name, Category category, Ingredient[] ingredients, BigDecimal price, String typeOfMeat)
      Constructs a MeatMeal with the specified name, category, ingredients, price, and type of meat.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the meal.
      category - the category of the meal.
      ingredients - the ingredients of the meal.
      price - the price of the meal.
      typeOfMeat - the type of meat used in the meal.

    • getTypeOfMeat

      public String getTypeOfMeat()
      Returns the type of meat used in the meal.
      Returns:
      the type of meat.

    • setTypeOfMeat

      public void setTypeOfMeat(String typeOfMeat)
      Sets the type of meat for the meal.
      Parameters:
      typeOfMeat - the type of meat to set.

    • isRaw

      public boolean isRaw()
      Returns whether the meat is raw. This method is overridden from the Meat interface and always returns false for a MeatMeal, as the meat is assumed to be cooked.
      Specified by:
      isRaw in interface Meat
      Returns:
      false, as meat in this meal is not raw.

    • comesWithASide

      public boolean comesWithASide()
      Returns whether the meal comes with a side dish. This method is overridden from the Meat interface and always returns true for a MeatMeal, as it is assumed that meat meals are served with a side.
      Specified by:
      comesWithASide in interface Meat
      Returns:
      true, as meat meals are assumed to come with a side dish.
